values.comment: Infix notation for *IO.map*.
values.type: IO.IO model a -> (a -> b) -> IO.IO model b

values.comment: Infix notation for *IO.ap*.
values.type: IO.IO model (a -> b) -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model b

values.comment: Infix notation for *IO.combine*.
values.type: IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model a

values.comment: Infix notation for *IO.bind*.
values.type: IO.IO model a -> (a -> IO.IO model b) -> IO.IO model b

values.name: <째>
values.comment: Infix notation for *Select.compose*.
values.type: Select.Select a b -> Select.Select b c -> Select.Select a c

name: IO

types.name: IO
types.comment:
Monadic interface for *The Elm Architecture*.

A value of type `IO model a` is an effectful
computation that can modify the model `model`,
perform commands and contains values of type `a`.

values.name: ap
values.comment:
Transform an *IO* containing functions into functions on *IO*
It enable to easily lift functions to *IO*.

**Laws**
- ```ap (pure identity) = identity```
- ```ap (pure (f >> g)) = ap (pure f) >> ap (pure g)```
values.type: IO.IO model (a -> b) -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model b

values.name: batch
values.comment:
Combine a list of *IO*. Its use is strongly discouraged!
Use *mapM* instead!
values.type: List (IO.IO model a) -> IO.IO model a

values.name: beginnerProgram
values.comment: Port of *Platform.program* with *IO* with *dummyUpdate*.
values.type: { init : model , main : IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: beginnerProgramWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *Platform.programWithFlags* with *IO* with *dummyUpdate*.
values.type: { init : flags -> model , main : IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program flags model msg

values.name: beginnerVDomProgram
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom.program* with *IO* with *dummyUpdate* (also works with *Html*).
values.type: { init : model , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (IO.IO model msg) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: beginnerVDomProgramWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom.programWithFlags* with *IO* (also works with *Html*).
values.type: { init : flags -> model , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (IO.IO model msg) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program flags model msg

values.name: bind
values.comment:
Chains *IO*s.

If you have an *IO model a* and a function which given
a *a* can give you an *IO model b* depending on the value
of type *a* given to the function. Then *bind* gives you
an *IO model b* that will run the first *IO* and then apply
the function.

**Laws**
- ```bind pure = identity```
- ```bind (f >> pure) = map f```
- ```(bind f) >> (bind g) = bind (a -> bind g (f a))```
values.type: (a -> IO.IO model b) -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model b

values.name: combine
values.comment:
Combine two *IO*. Its use is strongly discouraged!
Use *mapM instead!
values.type: IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model a

values.name: dummySub
values.comment: Dummy subscription function
values.type: a -> Platform.Sub.Sub b

values.name: dummyUpdate
values.comment: Dummy update function.
values.type: a -> IO.IO b c

values.name: get
values.comment: An *IO* that returns the current model.
values.type: IO.IO model model

values.name: join
values.comment:
Flatten an *IO* containing an *IO* into a simple *IO*.

**Laws**
- ```join (pure m) = m```
values.type: IO.IO model (IO.IO model a) -> IO.IO model a

values.name: lens
values.comment:
Congruence by a *Lens* on an *IO*.

It would be silly to force users to redefine every *IO*
for each application model. Lenses enable to lift an *IO*
action on a model *a* to the same *IO* but action on a
model *b*.

You can then define your *IO* on the minimal model and
lift them to you real application's model when needed.
values.type: Lens.Lens a b -> IO.IO a msg -> IO.IO b msg

values.name: lift
values.comment: Lift a *Cmd* as an  *IO*.
values.type: Platform.Cmd.Cmd a -> IO.IO model a

values.name: liftM
values.comment: Lift a *CmdM* as an *IO*.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a -> IO.IO model a

values.name: liftUpdate
values.comment: Lift a classic update function into an *IO*.
values.type: (model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd a )) -> IO.IO model a

values.name: map
values.comment:
Map a function over an *IO*.

**Laws**
- ```map (f >> g) = (map f) >> (map g)```
- ```map identity = identity```
values.type: (a -> b) -> IO.IO model a -> IO.IO model b

values.name: mapM
values.comment: Transform a list of `IO` into an `IO` of list.
values.type: List (IO.IO model a) -> IO.IO model (List a)

values.name: modify
values.comment: A *IO* that modify the model.
values.type: (model -> model) -> IO.IO model ()

values.name: none
values.comment: An *IO* doing nothing (an containing no values!).
values.type: IO.IO model a

values.name: program
values.comment: Port of *Platform.program* with *IO*.
values.type: { init : ( model, IO.IO model msg ) , update : msg -> IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: programWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *Platform.programWithFlags* with *IO*.
values.type: { init : flags -> ( model, IO.IO model msg ) , update : msg -> IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program flags model msg

values.name: pure
values.comment: Returns an *IO* whose only effect is containing the value given to *pure*.
values.type: a -> IO.IO model a

values.name: select
values.comment:
Congruence by a *Select* on an *IO*.
Just like lenses but with *Select*.
values.type: Select.Select a b -> IO.IO a msg -> IO.IO b msg

values.name: set
values.comment: An *IO* that sets the model.
values.type: model -> IO.IO model ()

values.name: transform
values.comment: Transform a program using *IO* into a normal program.
values.type: { y | init : ( model, IO.IO model msg ), update : msg -> IO.IO model msg } -> { y | init : ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (IO.IO model msg) ), update : IO.IO model msg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (IO.IO model msg) ) }

values.name: transformWithFlags
values.comment: Transform a program using *IO* into a normal program.
values.type: { y | init : flags -> ( model, IO.IO model msg ), update : msg -> IO.IO model msg } -> { y | init : flags -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (IO.IO model msg) ), update : IO.IO model msg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (IO.IO model msg) ) }

values.name: traverse
values.comment:
You can think of traverse like a *map* but with effects.
It maps a function performing *IO* effects over a list.
values.type: (a -> IO.IO model b) -> List a -> IO.IO model (List b)

values.name: vDomProgram
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom.program* with *IO* (also works with *Html*).
values.type: { init : ( model, IO.IO model msg ) , update : msg -> IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: vDomProgramWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom.programWithFlags* with *IO* (also works with *Html*).
values.type: { init : flags -> ( model, IO.IO model msg ) , update : msg -> IO.IO model msg , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (IO.IO model msg) , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (IO.IO model msg) } -> IO.Program flags model msg

values.comment: Infix notation for *CmdM.map*.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a -> (a -> b) -> CmdM.CmdM b

values.comment: Infix notation for *CmdM.ap*.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM (a -> b) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM b

values.comment: Infix notation for *CmdM.combine*.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.comment: Infix notation for *CmdM.bind*.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a -> (a -> CmdM.CmdM b) -> CmdM.CmdM b

name: Select
comment:
Selects are a lot like lenses but in a select
from type *a* to *b*, the *a* part may not exist
in *b*.

@docs Select, lift, nothing, compose, congruence

values.name: compose
values.comment: Compose two selects.
values.type: Select.Select a b -> Select.Select b c -> Select.Select a c

values.name: congruence
values.comment:
If you have a lens from *a* to *b* and a function on *a*
then you get a function on *b*.
values.type: Select.Select a b -> (a -> a) -> b -> b

values.name: lift
values.comment: Build a lens from an equivalence between types *a* and *b*.
values.type: Lens.Lens a b -> Select.Select a b

values.name: nothing
values.comment: A select that always fails.
values.type: Select.Select a b

values.name: <째>
values.comment: Infix notation for *Lens.compose*.
values.type: Lens.Lens a b -> Lens.Lens b c -> Lens.Lens a c

name: CmdM

types.name: CmdM
types.comment:
Monadic interface for commands.

A value of type `CmdM msg` is an effectful
computation that can perform commands and
contains values of type `msg`.

values.name: ap
values.comment:
Transform a *CmdM* containing functions into functions on *CmdM*.
It enable to easily lift functions to *CmdM*.

**Laws**
- ```ap (pure identity) = identity```
- ```ap (pure (f >> g)) = ap (pure f) >> ap (pure g)```
values.type: CmdM.CmdM (a -> b) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM b

values.name: batch
values.comment:
Group commands in a batch. Its behavior may not be what you expect!
I strongly discourage you from using it. Use *mapM* instead.
values.type: List (CmdM.CmdM a) -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: bind
values.comment:
Chains *CmdM*s.

If you have a `CmdM a` and a function which given
a `a` can give you a `CmdM b` depending on the value
of type `a` given to the function. Then `bind` gives you
a `CmdM b` that will run the first `CmdM` and then apply
the function.

**Laws**
- ```bind pure = identity```
- ```bind (f >> pure) = map f```
- ```(bind f) >> (bind g) = bind (a -> bind g (f a))```
values.type: (a -> CmdM.CmdM b) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM b

values.name: combine
values.comment:
Group commands in a batch. Its behavior may not be what you expect!
I strongly discourage you from using it. Use *mapM* instead.
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: fold
values.comment: Catamorphism for *CmdM*. Strict version.
values.type: (a -> r) -> (Platform.Cmd.Cmd r -> r) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> r

values.name: join
values.comment:
Flatten a *CmdM* containing a *CmdM* into a simple *CmdM*.

**Laws**
- ```join (pure m) = m```
values.type: CmdM.CmdM (CmdM.CmdM a) -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: lazyFold
values.comment: Catamorphism for *CmdM*. Lazy version.
values.type: (a -> r) -> ((() -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd r) -> r) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> r

values.name: lift
values.comment: Transforms an Elm command into a monadic command *CmdM*.
values.type: Platform.Cmd.Cmd a -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: map
values.comment:
Map a function over an *CmdM*.

**Laws**
- ```map (f >> g) = (map f) >> (map g)```
- ```map identity = identity```
values.type: (a -> b) -> CmdM.CmdM a -> CmdM.CmdM b

values.name: mapM
values.comment: Transform a list of *CmdM* into an *CmdM* of list.
values.type: List (CmdM.CmdM a) -> CmdM.CmdM (List a)

values.name: none
values.comment: A *CmdM* doing nothing (an containing no values!).
values.type: CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: program
values.comment: Port of *Platform*.program with *IO*.
values.type: { init : ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (CmdM.CmdM msg) } -> CmdM.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: programWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *Platform.programWithFlags* with *CmdM*.
values.type: { init : flags -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (CmdM.CmdM msg) } -> CmdM.Program flags model msg

values.name: pure
values.comment: Returns a *CmdM* whose only effect is containing the value given to *pure*.
values.type: a -> CmdM.CmdM a

values.name: transform
values.comment: Transform a program using *IO* into a normal program.
values.type: { y | init : ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ), update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) } -> { y | init : ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (CmdM.CmdM msg) ), update : CmdM.CmdM msg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (CmdM.CmdM msg) ) }

values.name: transformWithFlags
values.comment: Transform a program using *CmdM* into a normal program.
values.type: { y | init : flags -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ), update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) } -> { y | init : flags -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (CmdM.CmdM msg) ), update : CmdM.CmdM msg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (CmdM.CmdM msg) ) }

values.name: traverse
values.comment:
You can think of traverse like a *map* but with effects.
It maps a function performing `CmdM` effects over a list.
values.type: (a -> CmdM.CmdM b) -> List a -> CmdM.CmdM (List b)

values.name: vDomProgram
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom*.program with *CmdM* (also works with *HTML*).
values.type: { init : ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (CmdM.CmdM msg) , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (CmdM.CmdM msg) } -> CmdM.Program Basics.Never model msg

values.name: vDomProgramWithFlags
values.comment: Port of *VirtualDom.programWithFlags* with *CmdM* (also works with *Html*).
values.type: { init : flags -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , update : msg -> model -> ( model, CmdM.CmdM msg ) , subscriptions : model -> Platform.Sub.Sub (CmdM.CmdM msg) , view : model -> VirtualDom.Node (CmdM.CmdM msg) } -> CmdM.Program flags model msg

name: Lens
comment:
Imagine the type `a = {name: String, age : Int}`.
If you want to access the *age* part of this type
or modify only the *age* this is simple you would use
**Elm** syntax like `x.age` or `{x | age = 7 }` to ease
the process.

Now imagine that the *a* is much much more complex, like
a record whose fields are also records and so on for 10 levels.
Elm does not have buitin syntax to ease this case. That's
where lenses comes in.

A lens is like zooming on a part of a type, enabling to access
or modify this part with ease. It is strongly related to Huet's
zipper.

Take the a lens of type `Lens a b`. It enable to access the *a*
part of *b* and modify it simply. The benefits of lenses is they
compose naturally.

@docs Lens, lift, compose, congruence

values.name: compose
values.comment: Compose two lenses.
values.type: Lens.Lens a b -> Lens.Lens b c -> Lens.Lens a c

values.name: congruence
values.comment:
If you have a lens from *a* to *b* and a function on *a*
then you get a function on *b*.
values.type: Lens.Lens a b -> (a -> a) -> b -> b

values.name: lift
values.comment: Build a lens from an equivalence between types *a* and *b*.
values.type: (a -> b) -> (b -> a) -> Lens.Lens a b
